# 2.1. Exercises

## ✍️ Practice: How branches are related

<div id='mcq1'></div>
<script>
    generateQuiz(
        'mcq1',
        'True or False',
        'The labels <code>origin/main</code> and <code>origin/HEAD</code> always will be associated to the more recent commit in the history of a project that you have just cloned from GitHub.',
        {
        'True': 'What happens if the latest change in the GitHub repository was made on a branch other than <code>main</code>? Try reproducing this on your own computer by creating a new branch in the remote repository and then pulling the changes into your local repository!',
        'False': 'The term <code>origin</code> refers to the remote repository. If the most recent change in the remote repository you are cloning was made on a branch other than <code>main</code>, the label on the latest commit will appear as (<code>origin/new-branch</code>). <code>origin/HEAD</code> will always point to the latest commit on the main branch, unless the default branch has been changed in the GitHub settings.',
        },
        'False',
    );
</script>
